availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

body.p: Brigadier General, Chief of Ordinance in the U.S. Army. Virginia Native. Son of Andrew and Catherine Ramsay. Married to Eliza Ramsay. Father of Frances M. Ramsay, Juliana G. Ramsay, George D. Ramsay, Joseph G. Ramsay, and Catherine G. Ramsay. Graduated from the United States Military Academy in 1820. Fought in the Mexican-American War. Promoted to major of ordnance in April, 1861, lieutenant-colonel in August, 1861, and colonel in 1863. Appointed chief of ordnance in September 1863 with brigadier general rank. Served as brigadier general until 1864. Retired from active service in September 1864. Died May 23, 1882.

ab.bibl: Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Pennsylvania, Philadelphia County, p. 26.Historical Register and Dictionary of the United States Army: From Its Organization, September 29, 1789, to March 2, 1903, vol. 1(Washington: Govt. Print. Off., 1903), p. 25. The Union Army: A History of Military Affairs in the Loyal States 1861-1865, vol. 8 (Madison, WI: Federal Publishing Company, 1908), p. 206. Find A Grave, "George D. Ramsay (1801-1882)," Memorial #5886876 , http://www.findagrave.com/memorial/5886876 (accessed [May 22, 2018]).
